info.description: The Revenue API contains operations that expose Workday Financials Revenue data. It includes data related to customer contracts and billable transactions.
info.title: Revenue (v2Alpha)

tags.name: customerContractAmendments
tags.description: All the Customer Contract Amendments in Workday.

tags.name: usageBasedTransactions
tags.description: All the Usage Based Transactions not invoiced in Workday, sorted by creation date (descending).

tags.name: customerContracts
tags.description: All the Customer Contracts in Workday.

tags.name: billableTransactions
tags.description: All Billable Transactions not invoiced in Workday.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of customer contract amendment headers.
get.description:
Secured by: Process: Customer Contract - View, Reports: Organization Customer Contract

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: contract
parameters.description: The Customer Contract for this Amendment

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The contract number for the contract.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection.

post.summary: Creates a customer contract amendment header.
post.description:
Secured by: Create Customer Contract Amendment (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

Secured by: Create Customer Contract Amendment (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract amendment to submit. Use the GET customerContractAmendments operation to retrieve a collection of customer contract amendments.

get.summary: Retrieves a customer contract amendment header for the specified ID.
get.description:
Secured by: Process: Customer Contract - View, Reports: Organization Customer Contract

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract amendment to retrieve. Use the GET customerContractAmendments operation to retrieve a collection of customer contract amendments.

patch.summary: Updates the customer contract amendment header.
patch.description:
Updates the existing customer contract amendment with the specified data in the request body.  Data not included in the request body will not be updated.

If the customer contract amendment does not exist, the request fails with an HTTP error code 404.

Secured by: Create Customer Contract Amendment (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contract

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract amendment to update. Use the GET customerContractAmendments operation to retrieve a collection of customer contract amendments.

post.description:
Secured by: Create Customer Contract Amendment (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract amendment to cancel. Use the GET customerContractAmendments operation to retrieve a collection of customer contract amendments.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of customer contract amendment lines for the specified customer contract amendment.
get.description:
This returns the contract lines for a customer contract amendment.  Lines are sorted by line number.

Secured by: Process: Customer Contract - View, Reports: Organization Customer Contract Lines

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract amendment to retrieve lines for. Use the GET customerContractAmendments operation to retrieve a collection of customer contract amendments.

post.summary: Creates a customer contract amendment line for the specified customer contract amendment.
post.description:
Secured by: Create Customer Contract Amendment (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract amendment to post a line for. Use the GET customerContractAmendments operation to retrieve a collection of customer contract amendments.

delete.summary: Deletes a draft customer contract amendment line.
delete.description:
Secured by: Create Customer Contract Amendment (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract amendment of the line to delete. Use the GET customerContractAmendments operation to retrieve a collection of customer contract amendments.

parameters.name: lineID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract amendment line to delete. Use the GET customerContractAmendments/{ID}/lines operation to retrieve a collection of customer contract amendment lines.

patch.summary: Updates the customer contract amendment line for the specified customer contract amendment.
patch.description:
Updates the existing customer contract amendment line with the specified data in the request body. Data not included in the request body will not be updated.

If the customer contract amendment line does not exist, the request fails with an HTTP error code 404.

Secured by: Create Customer Contract Amendment (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract amendment of the line to update. Use the GET customerContractAmendments operation to retrieve a collection of customer contract amendments.

parameters.name: lineID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract amendment line to update. Use the GET customerContractAmendments/{ID}/lines operation to retrieve a collection of customer contract amendment lines.

get.summary: Retrieve a collection of usage based transactions.
get.description:
Secured by: Process: Billing

Scope: Project Billing

parameters.name: contract
parameters.description: Customer Contract tied to the Billable Transaction.

parameters.name: revenueStatus
parameters.description: The revenue recognition status for this billable transaction.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Date the transaction was incurred against.

parameters.name: billingStatus
parameters.description: The current billing status of the transaction. (Awaiting Review, Do Not Bill, Hold, Ready to Bill, Invoiced)

parameters.name: unitOfMeasure
parameters.description: Unit of Measure for the Usage Based Transaction.

parameters.name: customer
parameters.description: Customer for the Usage Based Transaction.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Date the transaction was incurred against.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Company for the Usage Based Transaction.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection.

get.summary: Retrieve a usage based transaction for the specified ID.
get.description:
Secured by: Process: Billing

Scope: Project Billing

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the usage based transaction to retrieve. Use the GET usageBasedTransactions operation to retrieve a collection of usage based transactions.

patch.description:
Updates the existing usage based transaction with the specified data in the request body. Data not included in the request body will not be updated.

If the usage based transaction does not exist, the request fails with an HTTP error code 404.

Secured by: Process: Billing

Scope: Project Billing

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the usage based transaction to update. Use the GET usageBasedTransactions operation to retrieve a collection of usage based transactions.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of customer contract headers.
get.description:
Secured by: Process: Customer Contract - View, Reports: Organization Customer Contract

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The contract number for the contract.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Date Contract becomes Effective

parameters.name: billToCustomer
parameters.description: The bill to customer for the customer contract.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company for the reporting transaction.

parameters.name: soldToCustomer
parameters.description: The sold to customer for the contract.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Date Contract becomes Effective

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection.

post.description:
Secured by: Create Customer Contract (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

Secured by: Create Customer Contract (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract to submit. Use the GET customerContracts operation to retrieve a collection of customer contracts.

get.summary: Retrieves a customer contract header for the specified ID.
get.description:
Secured by: Process: Customer Contract - View, Reports: Organization Customer Contract

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract to retrieve. Use the GET customerContracts operation to retrieve a collection of customer contracts.

patch.description:
Updates the existing customer contract with the specified data in the request body. Data not included in the request body will not be updated.

If the customer contract does not exist, the request fails with an HTTP error code 404.

Secured by: Create Customer Contract (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract to update. Use the GET customerContracts operation to retrieve a collection of customer contracts.

post.description:
Secured by: Create Customer Contract Amendment (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract to cancel. Use the GET customerContracts operation to retrieve a collection of customer contracts.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of customer contract lines for the specified customer contract.
get.description:
This returns the contract lines for a customer contract.  Lines are sorted by line number.

Secured by: Process: Customer Contract - View, Reports: Organization Customer Contract Lines

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract to retrieve lines for. Use the GET customerContracts operation to retrieve a collection of customer contracts.

post.summary: Creates a customer contract line for the specified customer contract.
post.description:
Secured by: Create Customer Contract (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract to post a line for. Use the GET customerContracts operation to retrieve a collection of customer contracts.

delete.summary: Deletes a draft customer contract line.
delete.description:
Secured by: Create Customer Contract (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract of the line to delete. Use the GET customerContracts operation to retrieve a collection of customer contracts.

parameters.name: lineID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract line to delete. Use the GET customerContracts/{ID}/lines operation to retrieve a collection of customer contract lines.

patch.summary: Updates the customer contract line for the specified customer contract.
patch.description:
Updates the existing customer contract line with the specified data in the request body. Data not included in the request body will not be updated.

If the customer contract line does not exist, the request fails with an HTTP error code 404.

Secured by: Create Customer Contract (REST Service)

Scope: Customer Contracts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract of the line to update. Use the GET customerContracts operation to retrieve a collection of customer contracts.

parameters.name: lineID
parameters.description: The ID of the customer contract line to update. Use the GET customerContracts/{ID}/lines operation to retrieve a collection of customer contract lines.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of billable transactions.
get.description:
Secured by: Manage: Project Details, Process: Project Billing

Scope: Project Billing

parameters.name: billingStatus
parameters.description: The current billing status of the transaction. (Awaiting Review, Do Not Bill, Hold, Ready to Bill, Invoiced)

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: Related ~worker~ tied to this billable transaction (i.e. ~worker~ on the expense report or the ~worker~ the time sheet).

parameters.name: spendCategory
parameters.description: If the billable transaction is tied to an expense report line, then this field returns the spend category for that line.

parameters.name: timeCode
parameters.description: If the billable transaction is tied to an time sheet line, then this field returns the time code for that line.

parameters.name: phase
parameters.description: If the billable transaction is tied to an time sheet line, then this field returns the phase for that line.

parameters.name: task
parameters.description: If the billable transaction is tied to an time sheet line, then this field returns the task for that line.

parameters.name: customer
parameters.description: Customer tied to the ~project~ for this transaction.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Date the transaction was incurred against.

parameters.name: transactionSource
parameters.description: Identifies what type of transaction composes this billable transaction (i.e. expense report line versus time sheet line).

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Date the transaction was incurred against.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The ~project~ this transaction is being billed against.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of billing rate applications for the specified billable transaction.
get.description:
Secured by: Manage: Project Details, Process: Project Billing

Scope: Project Billing

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the billable transaction to retrieve billing rate applications for. Use the GET billableTransactions operation to retrieve a collection of billable transactions.

get.summary: Retrieves a billable transaction for the specified ID.
get.description:
Secured by: Manage: Project Details, Process: Project Billing

Scope: Project Billing

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the billable transaction to retrieve. Use the GET billableTransactions operation to retrieve a collection of billable transactions.

patch.description:
Updates the existing billable transaction with the specified data in the request body. Data not included in the request body will not be updated.

If the billable transaction does not exist, the request fails with an HTTP error code 404.

Secured by: Manage: Project Details, Process: Project Billing

Scope: Project Billing

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The ID of the billable transaction to update. Use the GET billableTransactions operation to retrieve a collection of billable transactions.

amendmentNumber.description: The amendment number for the customer contract.

name.description: The contract name for the customer contract.

amendmentEffectiveDate.description: The amendment effective date for the contract.

number.description: The contract number for the contract.

lineCount.description: The number of Contract Lines for the Customer Contract.

poNumber.description: The purchase order number for the customer contract.

signedDate.description: The contract signed date for the customer contract.

billingNotes.description: The billing notes for the customer contract.

amount.description: The current contract amount for the customer contract.

event.description: Returns any related Events for this document.

itemDescription.description: The line item description persisted for the document line.

amount.description: The extended amount for the document line.  Excludes Extended Amounts on Tax Only Invoices.

quantity.description: The quantity for the document line.

billingFromDate.description: The Billing From Date for Customer Contract Line.

billingToDate.description: The Billing To Date for Customer Contract Line.

unitPrice.description: The unit cost for the customer contract line.

number.description: The Line Number for the contract line.

quantity2.description: The second Quantity value on the document line.

transactionDate.description: Date the transaction was incurred against.

revenueStartDate.description: The Revenue Start Date for the Usage Based Transaction.

revenueEndDate.description: The Revenue End Date for the Usage Based Transaction.

description.description: Description for the Usage Based Transaction.

rateToBill.description: Actual rate the transaction should bill.

quantity.description: The usage count or the quantity for the Billable Transaction.

description.description: Description for the Usage Based Transaction.

rateToBill.description: Actual rate the transaction should bill.

amount.description: The current contract amount for the customer contract.

poNumber.description: The purchase order number for the customer contract.

name.description: The contract name for the customer contract.

lineCount.description: The number of Contract Lines for the Customer Contract.

signedDate.description: The contract signed date for the customer contract.

number.description: The contract number for the contract.

billingNotes.description: The billing notes for the customer contract.

event.description: Returns any related Events for this document.

amendmentEffectiveDate.description: The amendment effective date for the contract.

quantity2.description: The second Quantity value on the document line.

itemDescription.description: The line item description persisted for the document line.

quantity.description: The quantity for the document line.

unitPrice.description: The unit cost for the customer contract line.

amount.description: The extended amount for the document line.  Excludes Extended Amounts on Tax Only Invoices.

billingToDate.description: The Billing To Date for Customer Contract Line.

billingFromDate.description: The Billing From Date for Customer Contract Line.

number.description: The Line Number for the contract line.

hoursToBill.description: Actual hours this transaction should bill.

zeroAmountToBill.description: If flag set, change Amount To Bill passed in.

rateToBill.description: Actual rate the transaction should bill.

amountToBill.description: The amount to bill the customer, rounded for currency precision.  Excludes Extended Amounts on Tax Only Invoices.

previouslyInvoiced.description: True if its a previously invoiced Billable Transaction.

invoiceDescription.description: Supplier invoice line item description for the billable transaction.

adjustmentCount.description: Count of Billing Rate Applications for this Billing Transaction.

hoursToBill.description: Actual hours this transaction should bill.

zeroAmountToBill.description: If flag set, change Amount To Bill passed in.

billableRate.description: The original rate to bill the customer.

rateToBill.description: Actual rate the transaction should bill.

billableAmount.description: The original amount to bill the customer.  Excludes Extended Amounts on Tax Only Invoices.

transactionDate.description: Date the transaction was incurred against.

amountToBill.description: The amount to bill the customer, rounded for currency precision.  Excludes Extended Amounts on Tax Only Invoices.

billableHours.description: The original hours to bill the customer.

billingRateRuleType.description: The type of rate rule for this application.

reasonForChange.description: The reason for change for this adjustment.

amountToBill.description: The total amount applied to the billing rate rule break on this transaction in the currency of the Billing Schedule of the Contract Line of the Billable Transaction the Billing Rate Application is for.

ruleName.description: The billing rate rule name associated with this transaction.

quantityToBill.description: The units applied to the billing rate rule break on this transaction.

rateAdjustmentAmount.description: The rate adjustment amount for the billable transaction.

rateStartingAmount.description: The starting rate amount, before adjustment.

applicationOrder.description: The order of this adjustment in the change history of the billable transaction.

rateEndingAmount.description: The ending rate amount, after adjustment.

items.description: This object represents the possible facets for this resource

facetParameter.description: The alias used to select the facet

count.description: The number of instances returned by this facet

notes.description: Notes from the customer contract line Renewal Terms.

rate.description: The renewal rate (unit price) for the customer contract line.

amount.description: The Renewal Amount (Extended Amount) for the customer contract line.

quantity.description: Renewal Quantity for the customer contract line.

optOutPeriod.description: The opt-out or notification period specified for the customer Contract Line Renewal in number of days.

percent.description: The Renewal Percent for the customer contract line.

toDate.description: The end date of the Renewal Terms for the customer contract line.

autoRenew.description: Returns true if Renewal Terms set a contract line to Auto-Renew.

quantity2.description: Renewal Quantity 2 for the customer contract line.

fromDate.description: The start date of the Renewal Terms for the customer contract line.

coTerm.description: Returns true if Renewal Terms set a contract line to co-terminate.
